data.title: St Louis City Hall, St Louis, MO
data.text: What a beautiful historic building right in the down area, near the arch. The interior is spectacular with marble, iron railings a fantastic ceiling. If you enjoy old buildings, don't miss this

data.title: The Ceiling is a Gem
data.text: I enjoy photographing interiors. The Old City Hall features a large lobby/atrium with beautiful marble stairs and railings along with a stunning ceiling. It's worth taking the time to enter the building for this view. To enter, you must pass through security, but the guards were friendly and had no problem with letting me enter with my camera and tripod.

data.title: If you are visiting STL and love WW1 & WW2 History.....
data.text: Make a quick stop inside and look for two wall displays. The first will be a memorial to fallen soldiers from WW1. It breaks down how they died including gas attacks. The second tells the story of an ill fated glider demonstration. Worth a look!

data.title: Buitifull old building
data.text: This is one of the oldest buildings , looks like no other style building in the saint louis area . Large darker building I could look at it all day . They just dont make buildings like this anymore . Looks like it should be in ancient europe

data.title: Beautiful
data.text: We went by this building several times during our stay in St. Louis, and my wife could not get over how awesome its appearance was.

data.title: rude as usual
data.text: i have never had a good experience or a nice worker experience at this place in over 30 years.  it will never change.  but the building always looks good and so do the floors.

data.title: Very Interesting Architecture
data.text: My wife and I stopped at Saint Louis City Hall while walking around in downtown and taking pictures. Unless you are taking pictures or appreciating the architecture, this place is probably not a destination for you. Since it was a Saturday, we did not attempt to go inside.

data.title: very cool architecture
data.text: The exterior is very cool looking.  It reminds me of a haunted house.  The interior is a bit shabby and rundown looking though.

data.title: Its, well, city hall.
data.text:
Its more appealing architecturally than something built in the 70's, but its functions and frustrations are the same for anyone at any city hall anywhere else in the country. 

Also, I'm not sure why the only picture here associated with city hall doesn't actually show city hall. That's the old courthouse folks.

data.title: Just a city hall
data.text: If you have to do business here fine but other than being old, there is nothing to really see.

data.title: not much besides the staircase
data.text: I appreciate the beauty of the architecture of City Hall when I'm there on business, but I would not recommend visiting it 'just for fun'

data.title: Great Staff!!
data.text: The staff here is amazing! The building is historic, with lots of character!

data.title: A beautiful, historic building in the French style
data.text: Inspired by the Hotel de Ville in Paris [their city hall], construction on this fabulous building was begun in 1890 and took 14 years to complete. Marble rotunda, fabulous grand staircase, must see to appreciate. They don't make them like this any more.

data.title: impozantní budova
data.text: Budova se širokým průčelím už na první pohled dává najevo, že se jedná o důležité sídlo. Radnice se nachází v centru a dá se k ní dostat pěšky během pár minut od vlastního jádra. Kolem budovy jsou rozmístěny sochy významných osobností spojených s městem (jako například zakladatel města nebo jedne z bývalých prezidentů USA pocházejících z této oblasti).
